title: Old-age dependency ratio by state and union territory in India 2011
summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing State And Union Territory, and Old-age dependency ratio in each State And Union Territory on the y axis.
State And Union Territory Kerala has the highest Old-age dependency ratio and Delhi has the lowest Old-age dependency ratio.
The highest State And Union Territory Kerala has 9.2 more Old-age dependency ratio than the lowest State And Union Territory Delhi.
min_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing State And Union Territory, and Old-age dependency ratio in each State And Union Territory on the y axis.
The Old-age dependency ratio is appeared to be the highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing State And Union Territory, and Old-age dependency ratio in each State And Union Territory on the y axis.
State And Union Territory Kerala has the highest Old-age dependency ratio and Delhi has the lowest Old-age dependency ratio.
The highest State And Union Territory Kerala has 9.2 more Old-age dependency ratio than the lowest State And Union Territory Delhi.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing State And Union Territory in the x axis and Old-age dependency ratio in the y axis.
The Old-age dependency ratio is appeared to be the highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
The second highest Old-age dependency ratio is appeared to be the State And Union Territory Punjab.
The Old-age dependency ratio of State And Union Territory Delhi is 1.88% smaller than the maximum value at Kerala.
The State And Union Territory Kerala has the highest Old-age dependency ratio, followed by Punjab, and Tamil Nadu. Down to the State And Union Territory Delhi which is the lowest.
State And Union Territory Andaman & Nicobar Islands, and Odisha share the same value 15.4.
The highest value 19.6 at Kerala is almost 1.39 times larger than the average value 14.09.
The Old-age dependency ratio is 281.8 if we add up values of all State And Union Territorys.
